sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {2, 4, 6, 8, 10} and B = {2, 3, 5, 7, 11} be two sets. Find the symmetric difference of sets A and B, and then find the intersection of the resulting set with set A. Also, find the symmetric difference of sets B and A, and then find the intersection of the resulting set with set A. Show that the symmetric difference of sets A and B is not commutative with respect to intersection.
